verdict.summary: The pack-objects process was killed (usually by OOM killer sending signal 9) during push or gc. Large repositories with many objects require significant memory for delta compression.

dead_ends.why_fails: postBuffer affects the HTTP transfer size, not the memory used by pack-objects for delta compression. The OOM condition persists.

dead_ends.action: Retrying the push immediately without changing configuration
dead_ends.why_fails: The same memory pressure causes the OOM killer to terminate pack-objects again each time

workarounds.action: Limit pack-objects memory usage and threads
workarounds.how: git config --global pack.windowMemory 100m && git config --global pack.packSizeLimit 100m && git config --global pack.threads 1. This reduces memory footprint at the cost of slower packing.

workarounds.action: Push in smaller batches using partial history
workarounds.how: Push a subset of commits: git push origin HEAD~100:refs/heads/main, then incrementally push more. This reduces the number of objects pack-objects must process at once.

leads_to.condition: when pack memory issues affect both sending and receiving sides
when gc triggers pack-objects which gets OOM-killed

preceded_by.condition: when auto-gc triggers pack-objects on a memory-constrained system

frequently_confused_with.distinction: pack-objects-died occurs during packing (push/gc); index-pack-failed occurs during unpacking (fetch/clone)
